caption: These flavors can't be missed. So much to be inspired by.
Really great food and atmosphere. Excited to go back again soon!
Food was absolutely amazing! Great atmosphere, friendly staff, well flavored food and generous portion size. Also they have some of the best miso soup Ive had.
Good food, Amazing Hospitality. I Wish, there could be more options for Vegan and Vegetarians. Tofu Osaka Okonomiyaki was good. Also there Pandan-Coconut Icecream was amazing.
Good food, good service 7/7
Authentic Japanese street food! Great service. Very responsive and attentive servers.
Fun atmosphere and delicious highballs

Highlights: Atmosphere Service Food ✅✅✅  Scrumptious Recommendations * VEGGIE KOROKKE river valley mushrooms / rice / curry / mighty vine tomatoes / daikon pickle / tonkatsu sauce * OSAKA-STYLE OKONOMIYAKI TOFU phoenix bean tofu / shichimi togarashi / river valley mushrooms / spinach / arare BEEF  cdk 21-day dry-aged slow-cooked beef / roasted garlic / scallions / bonito * MUSHROOM AND YUBA NEGIYAKI scallion / egg / ponzu / shio kombu
Great atmosphere, amazing customer service and food was nothing short of perfection! Tried at least one item from each menu and it was ALL amazing!
Great food, great service, great people, have a highball
The staff dances and makes good food. What more could a human want?

Everything about this restaurant is just above and beyond. From the food, to the wait staff, chefs, hostesses. Hands down one of the best places in Chicago and one place I keep coming back to over and over. Get the shrimp okonomiyaki. ❤

I came here for my birthday dinner with my boyfriend about a year ago. They bring the cooked okonomiyaki to your table and set it down on your table, which is.... a hot plate! Fun. The food was good, a bit overpriced in my opinion. Fun cocktails, which are also overpriced. Maybe I just think everything in Chicago is overpriced.

Impressive!  TL;DR: quality, taste, and price point are all there  After recently returning from living Japan I thought it would be a real struggle to find good okonomiyaki and yakisoba in Chicago, and I was right. Sushi and ramen are everywhere and decent, but I stumbled across Gaijin and was impressed. I thought the name was funny since it means foreigner but the food had authentic taste and they had great service. Also, the Kakigori for dessert was delicious! All around I enjoyed it here and will def be back.
Such a unique experience! Unlike any restaurant I’ve been too. Loved my vegetarian dish.
Great Asian comfort food!
Holy moly this place is so good!!! Try the octopus one, and make sure you get one of their mochi donuts.
The okonomiyaki is a must have, delicious ykaisoba and marinated beef shortrib. Cool vibes and friendly staff.
Best japanese pancakes. Service is great here. We got the vegan japanese pancake and a mochi donut. Also enjoyed some sake. Highly recommend if you're in the chicago area
Wonderful service and the food was delicious! 10/10 would recommend!

Not quite the trendy Japanese food experience I was hoping for. Dishes were all very salty, especially the marinated eggplant. Okonomiyaki (definitely did not spell it correctly, the pancakes) were novel but the shrimp topping felt more like walnut shrimp than properly fried shrimp tempura.
Okay food. Underwelming overall.

Get everything! Everything was delicious. The pork is more of a thick bacon slice than pork belly. Pro tip: pour the vodka on the center/middle of the shaved ice so the ice “falls in” instead of leaking to the side of the cup.

Fortunate to have visited Vie in 2010, Chef Paul Virant has subsequently made his way into Chicago-proper, and at Gaijin the self-professed outsider opts to take on one of Japan’s most beloved Street Foods while furthering his exploration of fermentation and umami.  Now fifty years old, and dedicating the Restaurant in Fulton Market to his wife who introduced Virant to Okonomiyaki after years of study in Japan, guests will currently find Gaijin operating amidst COVID-19 precautions – social distancing assured from patio to Chef’s Counter and staff exceedingly efficient.  The Windy City’s first Okonomiyaki restaurant, but also home to Pickles, Shaved Ice and a serious Beverage program, it is amidst street style and modestly-loud Hip Hop that diners are invited to relax from 5pm Tuesday through Thursday and noon Friday till Sunday.  Capable of seating sixty, though currently limited to half-that, it was after some perusal that both Hiroshima and Osaka styles of the savory Japanese Pancake were ordered, their preparation just inches away showing far more complexity than some might expect and no shortage of traditional imported Ingredients.  Serious about the product’s authenticity it was by request that Osaka-style was served first, a topping of Shrimp, Corn and spiced Butter all married to a fluffy base by Kewpie with no two bites the same while Hiroshima-style further incorporated chewy Yakisoba Noodles, Katsuobushi and Bacon atop a nearly-French Crepe on the bottom.  Lively even in inclement weather, staff still having fun while practicing all recommended safety measures, Dessert at Gaijin comes from Vie’s Pastry Chef Angelyne Canicosa, the $5 Rice Flour Donut a questionable value in comparison to $12 for a snowcapped mountain of Shaved Ice wrapped around housemade Gooey Butter Cake Ice Cream and decorated in artisan accoutrements.
Great food!  We ate outside and I loved the street atmosphere.
Awesome food and service!

I have fallen in love with this place all over again!! They take so many extra steps to make sure we all feel safe during Covid dining.  The food takes me overseas, but the sound of the L reminds me of how great Chicago is as a food scene. Gosh I missed this place so much  The staff is warm and friendly even behind the masks  Food suggestions: The Twice Cooked Garlic is delicious, just bring a breath mint :-) The Hiroshima Style Okonomiyaki is a cannot miss. The Short Ribs are fork tender

Great! We came looking for Okonomiyaki. We had this dish when we visited Japan and it was amazing. We ordered Hiroshima style vegetarian with choice of meat and came out really good! Their Kakigori is pretty amazing and full of fruits!!
So good! We had food to go. Felt like a warm atmosphere as we ordered.

Very instagrammable meals, will definitely give them that! Tasted alright, a few of the savory dishes were a bit too sweet for my liking. The okonomiyaki was alright, nothing to really write home about. The donuts were really nice, we tried the kinako and thoroughly enjoyed it! The shaved ice didn't have enough of the flavoring liquid seeped all the way through so it felt like we were just eating plain ice after a certain point. Overall, a decent place to check out!
Fantastic shaved ice!!
Amazing food, very friendly staff and great environment.
Great food, great service, great atmosphere.
If you're in Chicago and want okonomiyaki. This is your best bet.
The shrimp yakisoba was good although portion was small.  The okonomiyaki was good as well, but a little too salty for my liking.  Pricey.
Lives up to the hype! Will definitely be coming back

Absolutely delicious okonomiyaki. Each one has a different take on okonomiyaki, but none are traditional as far as ingredients.  The shrimp and pork ones were delicious.  Skip the short rib appetizer. Shaved ice for dessert was awesome. I didn't care for the donuts, too chewy in my opinion.  Overall, excellent place! Great service too.
Delicious food and dessert!
Food: Awesome experience - worth every dollar for truly singular experience - every dish and drink felt unreplicated in the city.  Service: If Carson is around, an amazing guy. Made it all time
The octopus Okonomiyaki was incredibly good.  Served in the pan it was made in, it was topped with Bonita and cabbage.  Perfect consistency.  Hard to find outside of japan.
Great food! Fun atmosphere and impeccable service! Love it!
Great food. Amazing Gaijin microbrew. Would definitely come again.
This was our first time trying this type of cuisine and it wasn't our cup of tea. The service and atmosphere were fantastic. Would try again for drinks and dessert.
Our waiter was the best. Interesting food.

Awesome place with awesome food. Went here the first day restaurant dining rooms could open with Phase Four in Illinois. The staff did a great job of making me and my wife feel safe and welcomed. I’ll definitely be back.
Tasted the most amazing pancakes and enjoyed the hospitality Chef Paul who exuded a sparkling personality. Great experience!!

The food and service was great. I highly recommend this place for a great Japanese experience. You must order a Okonomiyaki.  I was recently in Osaka, Japan and Okonomiyakis are very  popular there.  Everything was delicious!!!
Great Japanese pancake place
Great food. Great service. Great value.
The Osaka was delicious. Skip the bok choy. Treat yourself to a donut too. Take-out option was perfect, well wrapped and intact. Would order again!

My friend Nick G. recommended this place. He's the executive chef at the Hollywood casino so I took his word for it. And drove all the way from Plainfield. I had the scallion pancakes and octopus pancakes. With a side of short ribs and for dessert we tried the pineapple shaved ice. They were all very delicious. I will definitely be coming back to try the fried shrimp pancake that looked and smelled pretty good.
Okonomiyaki is excellent. Kakigore has too much ice to ice cream ratio.
Delicious food!

(Translated by Google) The dishes that have already been baked are served, so the image is slightly different from Japanese okonomiyaki. But the taste and appearance are good! It is reasonable and recommended.  (Original) 既に焼いてもらった物がサーブされるので、日本のお好み焼き屋とは少し違ったイメージ。だけど味と見た目はGood！リーズナブルだしおすすめです。
Incredible service and outstanding food!

Ate at the bar, enjoyed the mood and the great food. Everything was nice, I ordered the gaijin 75 twice as it was so well balanced. Had a bit of conversation with the waiters who seemed happy to be there. I’ll come back 👍

We stopped in here on our way back from time out market to get a drink. The food looked delicious but we were too full to eat. We decided instead to get kakigori (shaved ice) and a cocktail. The shaved ice was one of the best desserts we’ve ever had. It was super flavorful but not nearly as heavy as ice cream. I will definitely be back for dinner!
A decent novelty spot but the flavors are nothing special.
Dessert amazing

Hip place in the West Loop that is one of the few places in Chicago that offers Okonomiyaki at an affordable cost. The Okonomiyaki selection are westernized and contain ingredients you won’t find in traditional Okonomiyaki. Otherwise they were very tasty and appealing. The servers bring them and place then on a warming hot plate in the middle of your table. A normal size Okonomiyaki is enough for one person. They also have a sampler with smaller sized Okonomiyaki so you can try three different ones. The Kakigori isn’t something you can easily find in Chicago so it is definitely worth a try. The sesame Yuzu was good, except the sesame brittle was way too overpowering in taste. Would definitely be back to try more things off the menu.
The food is nothing special, relatively bland.

A very hip and cool new restaurant in the west loop area. Serving totally decked out Japanese pancakes and other unique and creative dishes. They definitely have some interesting drinks and cocktails as well as some teas which I haven’t seen in Chicago before. I ordered the pancake flight with the shrimp, octopus and pork options. It was delicious and the portion size was huge. I would definitely recommend this place if you haven’t tried Japanese pancakes yet. It’s a great experience for sure.

Came in with high expectations but everything seemed to have missed the mark. Although aesthetically pleasing, the flavors of each dish was underwhelming. The short rib was small and not very tender. The beef okinomiyaki was the only good part of the meal, though even that paled in comparison to the okonomiyaki available just a few blocks away at Little Goat Diner. Sad to say that I likely won't return.
Really great good. Hiroshima pancake was packed with flavor. Definitely recommend.
Gaijin was amazing overall! There is a wonderful selection of creative and flavorful dishes and drinks
This is a really nice place to have a casual meal featuring tasty unique food, a great space, and good music.
Quite sad about the food :/  Your water has oil floating in it. Please wash and sanitize your dishes!
Very great tasting okonomiyaki, my friend who actually worked in Japan for some time did actually mention that they tasted very authentic!

First time having Okonomiyaki and I'm wondering what took me so long to find about this place. Great space, amazing food and good service. The Octopos Okonomiyaki was amazing! I also enjoyed the twice cooked garlic and the matcha donut. The cherry blossom soda was good as well. Definitely recommended,  I will be back for sure.

Great food especially the octopus with thin/ramen type noodles from appetizer section. I'm sorry I can't remember there name of it, it was a few weeks ago. We also ordered the octopus for entree and my daughter suggested to do it with crispy rice. It was not my favorite to be honest. Flavor was great but the texture was a bit too soft. One thing that you have to try is their spicy sauce. Delicious We sat by the kitchen counter which I highly recommend. You get to see everything as it's being cooked, interact with the chef abs in our case we fit some mochi samples as well. I would go again no questions asked

We grabbed a seat at the bar at 9:30 PM on a Saturday. Service was friendly (and fast!). I would highly recommend their yakisoba and okonomiyaki flight, it was delicious.  Took off one star because we also ordered the shaved ice, which ended up being a bit tasteless -- but a great palate cleanser for the end of the meal. I was hoping for the creamy consistency that kakigori normally has. There was not nearly enough condensed milk or syrup.
Shaved ice is very good, not super sweet. Okonomiyaki is a little on the saltier side

Wow this place really blew me away. I thought it would be pretty decent, but literally every bite I took was amazing. We had the flight with octopus, shrimp, and beef. We also tried the pork yakisoba, twice cooked garlic, a couple of delicious drinks and to top it all off mochi donuts and delicious shaved ice. It has condensed milk that you can pour over for an extra layer of decadence, but the ice itself is already so delicious. The best part was that we came early when it wasn’t as busy and every person working there was friendly and super attentive.  Especially Jonie.  She really has a heart of hospitality and you could tell her team really enjoyed working with her.  Of everyone we encountered she made sure our party had everything we needed.  She showed us the clever storage in the seats, and even gave our baby daughter different toys to play with while we ate.  That's service that's above and beyond that you cannot find or teach. Thank you for a great night out, Jonie!
Very cool spot. Interesting and delicious eats, fun atmosphere and great drinks! I loved it!

Chef has definitely created a unique experience that Chicago was missing!! Recently went to Japan and this was such a wonderful representation of Osaka street food. The black sesame yuzu kakigore was amaaaazing!! Pork belly yakisoba on point. Shrimp and octopus okonomiyaki perfection. Nice vibe nice drinks Server had a hard time hearing us a little but still lovely Chef Virant came to check in on us too :)  Overall must try!!
Great food and tea, at affordable prices.  Great and friendly service.  Good Atmosphere.  Added a star as encouragement to keep improving, as the Chinese prononunciation of Gaijin.
Amazing, authentic food without the flight to Japan
Great flavors, fulfilling, & fun!
Cozy atmosphere, amazing food!
Get the mochi doughnuts
Fantastic food, great service. I will be back.
My take out order was fabulous! The best food I have had in a while.Light , flavourful,not overpowered by salt.Amazing!

Not a fan of this food, a bunch of stuff thrown together tastes rather blend.  For example,  Osaka-style with kimchi simply doesn't taste good (why would anyone cook kimchi is beyond me, it looses it's taste not to mention it's medicinal benefits). Traditional okonomiyaki was so so and rather greasy, again not my taste.  Hibiscus cocktail was very tasty.
Octopus Okonomiyaki was my favorite. Amazing and authentic Japanese savory pancakes! Will definitely come back soon.
Great food and excellent service!!!
great food, great place, great service! ask for tim as your server. he was awesome!

Excellent food for trying something new and it's a great value to boot!  Definitely need to make a reservation for weekend nights, but if you're lucky you might find a counter seat open up.  They might still be working out the timing of their reservations because we ended up waiting for 20 minutes despite having an 8pm Saturday night reservation. This wouldn't be so bad if their waiting area wasn't so small, and it was a freezing January night!  The Okonomiyaki is certainly something where your tastes can differ. So take a look at the menu and be prepared to try something new and different! I definitely preferred the traditional Hiroshima-style over the Osaka chicken oko. The food is made behind the counter, where you can watch if you have a seat there. Then it's brought out and set on your table, which is mostly a heated tray to keep them warm.  I'd recommend sharing them, and order more as you're getting close to finishing it. They'll just bring them out as they're prepared. The shaved ice desserts are tasty but not as good as the food.  All in all I'd like to go back and try some of the other options they have!
Unbelievable concept. I could eat Asian pancakes every day. Wonderful food and service.
Food is not great the drinks are bland and the seating is not family friendly.

Great ambiance. While the wine and sake list is small, it is well curated. Food is a bit Americanized from the versions in Osaka in texture, flavors, and ingredients but nonetheless a great experience to have in Chicago. Love that they have kim chi!
Food is delicious! I had the Kimchi, veggie pancake and the ice dessert. Very interesting flavors. Even though it's fried, it's not heavy.
Give the staff a freaking bonus, especially cashew lady, she's a trooper to the n'th  degree
Great food! We loved sitting at the counter. Also, there's storage for your coat/bag inside the stools, for those curious.
Just like we had it in Japan!!!! Vibe and food both on point
Scrumptious cocktails and dessert. The donut is just the right amount of chewy and sweet. I love their 1919 drink.
Located right outside Fulton Market. My first time trying Japanese food and I was not disappointed. Great options for vegetarian!
Love the food! Would definitely come again!
This is exactly like we had in Japan! Amazing vibe and amazing food !
(Translated by Google) Candy  (Original) noomdle

Stopped in on a recent Sunday night and Gaijin was crowded with a great, buzzy energy. And soon we discovered why it was so popular: the okinomiyaki is amazing! We had the flight so we could try several, and all were delicious. The Twice Cooked Garlic comes with a bowl or roasted garlic!! Both sake and cocktails were great, the service was good, and I can’t wait to go back.
I really wanted to like this place, but I was disappointed. The service was great, ambiance was good but food fell flat.

Knocked it out of the park.  Cozy dining room, fantastic starters, sides & okonomiyaki.  Stellar desserts, save room for the black sesame yuzu shaved ice.  Mochi donuts were delicious as well, we had the pandan coconut version.  Service was efficient and attentive without being overbearing.  Cocktail menu also had lots of great options- favorites were the gaijin 75 and the hibiscus whiskey cocktail. Really fun, creative use of teas & tea-based mixers for the drinks.  Would go back in a heartbeat.

Wow. This place is amazingly good. It's a very hip place with lots of noise and action but we were still able to talk.  I definitely recommend a reservation as it gets crowded.  We all loved the food and enjoyed everything we ate. One note, the portions are huge and you could definitely share an entree between two people.  The drinks were good as well. We met the owner and he was super friendly.  Go, don't wait. You won't regret it!
I loved the Japanese pancake.
Loved it. Kakigori is to die for as well as 950W high ball
Cozy and delish

This was my first time at Gaijin and it was a wonderful experience. The staff was very friendly as soon as we walked in the door. I am glad that they gave us the option of sitting at the grill or at a booth. I got to take pictures of how the okonomiyaki was made. It was a fun time. The sakura tea was very fragrant and refreshing while eating the okonomiyaki. I personally like the Hiroshima style the most so far, though I might be biased since the first time I had okonomiyaki was in Hiroshima. I want to come back here to try more items on the menu. There was also shaved ice and donuts to try but I was too full. This was a great first 2020 restaurant meal of the new year. I'll be bringing my friends here for sure. Thank you to all the staff there!
Absolutely delicious food! The flight of okonomiyaki was a great choice because I got to try a good variety of their signature dish. Don't touch the middle of the table!

My first time trying Okonomiyaki since I first heard of it watching anime as a kid. And I gotta say for my first time it was amazing! Seeing it all prepared before you eyes was a great bonus as well, but it's nothing compared to the main event that was my chicken Osaka Style okonomiyaki! I'll be sure to pop in more and try their other selections as well! A great place to sample a fabulously done staple of Japanese comfort food.
Amazing food, service and vibe!

We were here earlier this month and with friends coming into town last minute, I suggested we come back. They were (obviously) pretty booked with reservations but we were able to be seated quickly at the window counter. I don't remember everything we ordered (we had a lot among 4 people) but everything was amazing! I really enjoyed the octopus Okonomiyaki, the beef korokke (whatever they did to the tomato on the side was heavenly and I need a bowl full every day) and the special Kakigori (strawberry sorbet / white peach syrup / champagne jelly / house-made pocky / snow cap), seriously, my night could have ended after that!! LOVE THIS PLACE!! Sorry not many photos, we were digging right in because everything looked so good!
Fantastic food. Highly recommend going with a few people so you can sample across the menu.
A very unique restaurant! We tried both styles of pancakes and both were excellent. We also got the shaved ice for dessert and it was so fresh and delicious.
Love it!  The food was great!  The waiter was knowledgeable and friendly.  The perfect mixture of authentic and creative.  Definitely will be back.

Monica was a great server, very informative.  I enjoyed the experience of  seeing multiple dishes prepared right in front of us.  We had the Okonomiyaki flight....shrimp, beef, & chicken...shrimp being the best in that order.  Starter:  Greens Shared plate:  Twice cooked garlic, if you like roasted garlic, this is a hit.... Durant & Booth Cabernet,  cocktail: Renewal & Hope. Mochi donut:  matcha-citrus
Cool new place to try out unique food! The seating was a bit tight inside. You can see them cook the food if you get counter seating. Their dessert is pretty good too.
Almost like being in Japan.  Delicious food

We really enjoyed the food (veggie koroke, bok choy, octopus yakisoba, okonomiyaki flight & traditional Hiroshima-style oko), though the octopus was a bit over-cooked. Very delicious food. The main issue we had was the pacing. Way too fast. No sense of pacing of courses coming from the kitchen. 8pm reservation on a Saturday night and everything felt rushed. We had all our food within about 25 minutes. Could’ve been out in under an hour if we wanted to.
Great food. Try the desserts there. 😋

Loved how unique this place is. Super small, great food. We tried Hiroshima and Osaka sampler as well as a few aps. Our favorite was the Hiroshima vegetarian. Great drinks! Did the s’mores dessert, it was good not great. What was unfortunate was we had to wait 20 minutes past our reservations, which is frustrating.

I love okonomiyaki, so when I heard Chicago opened one I immediately made plans for an evening at this place! I had the most amazing hiroshima style okonomiyaki - yakisoba, egg, and bacon layered goodness that left me full and satisfied. But the dessert was fantastic! A sesame yuzu kakigori that was wolfed down by me and my friend with no regrets! Our server, William, was awesome and explained the whole menu for my group! Best early bday dinner ever!! Gonna invite more people to this place in the future!

Great Oriental blast. Ordered the Okonomiyaki  with octopus  Hiroshima style and it was  mouth watering delicious. A healthy size or portion their wine list is A+ and to top it ended with Up side down cake.  👍😊

Gaijin is an awesome addition to the Japanese dining scene in this city. Focusing on the Japanese comfort food Okonomiyaki, a savory pancake-like dish with a mixture of various ingredients. Food was fantastic and the servers are very attentive. Prices are quite reasonable for the quality. I definitely recommend grabbing a reservation, this is one of the hottest spots in town right now. Grab a mochi donut for dessert - it has a really interesting texture quite different vs regular donuts!
Fantastic okinomiyaki and highballs. Need I say more? Such a fun restaurant. Loved it.

When I heard Chef Paul was set to open this I had to go.   A big fan of his restaurant Vie I had faith this would be good.   It exceeded my expectations.   First of all, the place is classy but not pretentious.   The arctic char and short ribs were excellent.   The right size menu to please everybody but also able to keep the quality control excellent.   The staff is friendly and you can tell that they take pride in the quality of their food.

First time trying okonomiyaki and this restaurant opened up recently right by the pink Morgan stop. You can sit at a table with a flat top or sit at the counter and see your food being made!  We ordered the flight: shrimp, beef, and chicken as well as the traditional hiroshima style! My favorites were the shrimp and chicken. Super savory. The hiroshoma had noodles inside, a must try!  So unique - my friend and I absolutely loved it

Enjoyed my visit to Gaijin. I was very much looking forward to trying this for a while and may have raised my expectations pretty high. Hence, my 4 star rating instead of 5.  I made a reservation for lunch on Saturday but it really wasn't that busy, so you could probably walk in. We ordered one of each style of the okonomiyaki. Just to try a variety of stuff we had the Osaka-style flight with shrimp, pork and octopus, the traditional Hiroshima-style, and the Negiyaki. Personally I really enjoyed the Hiroshima-style okonomiyaki and the shrimp Osaka-style okonomiyaki. I think I would have enjoyed the Negiyaki more if we didn't accidentally drown it with the ponzu 😅 We also had a few teas which were pretty good. Overall, I really liked Gaijin, and will for sure go back sometime soon.

I think this place has a lot of promise, and I will likely return in the future, but I had several issues with my visit to Gaijin. Let me start off by saying, I LOVE okonomiyaki. It is my favorite Japanese dish and I lament the fact that it is so difficult to find in the U.S. When I heard there was a restaurant opening in my city that was dedicated to my favorite dish, I was VERY excited. We had a reservation for 3pm on Sunday for 6 people and we were seated very quickly. We put in an order for some appetizers and our main dishes. The appetizers were okay, we ordered the beef croquette and the short ribs. The short ribs were good but only two small pieces of meat, not worth the price. The beef croquette was good but others in my party were not as fond. Our okonomiyaki orders were taking a long time, so the waiter came over to offer us free drinks, no problem here. Eventually my tables food was delivered, except mine. I ordered a flight of three different okonomiyaki, and it took a LONG time. It was very clear that they had forgotten my order, but it does not appear that my forgotten order was put on "rush". I have cooked okonomiyaki at home and I have a good idea of how long it takes, and it does not take this long. I would estimate it took an extra 35-40min for my meal to arrive. I expect that they put my forgotten order on the back of the line to avoid having other patrons wait longer (as everyone was waiting a long time). By the time my meal finally arrived, everyone in my party had completely finished eating. Thankfully my meal was comped, but when I was so excited for this restaurant it was really discouraging to watch everyone around me eat while I sit around twiddling my thumbs. Regarding the meal itself, it was good okonomiyaki, but not AMAZING as I was hoping. The shrimp one was by far my favorite. Perhaps the best part of okonomiyaki is the delicious sauce it is served with, that I could barely taste on my dish. I really wish they would put extra sauce bottles on the tables so guests can add more. My waiter was fabulous and I could tell he felt bad, but it is clear that there are issues that need to be worked out in the kitchen. You can see everything being cooked from the table, and they have almost as many chefs as they have chairs in the restaurant. I am unsure of why their process is so inefficient. In the end they probably ended up giving us $40-$50 of free stuff because of their service issues. Maybe I will come back in a year when everything is worked out.

American take on okonomiyaki! Bold and tasty. Don't expect traditional flavors - they use pulled pork, sausage and glazed bacon, which is pretty unorthodox. Price is reasonable and portions are big. Ask for warm nihonshu (atsukan) to warm up during cold winter :)  And yes, they cook okonomiyaki for you.

This restaurant was the perfect place for us to have lunch on a trip to Chicago. The staff was super friendly. We got one Osaka style savory pancake (beef) and one Hiroshima style (traditional) and they blew us away. I would recommend adding crispy rice to any of the Hiroshima style. Also, don’t sleep on the shaved ice dessert menu.

Absolutely fantastic! The pork belly with noodles is delicious and a generous portion. The Gaijin drink is my favorite. The restaurant feels very New York. You can watch the food being cooked, tables have warmers and it’s one of my new favorite spots to bring friends to.  Staff is friendly and seem genuinely happy. But that seems to be a trend with Paul’s restaurants.
Unique experience. Delicious food!
Amazing food made right in front of you if you can snag a spot at the bar! Order the flight so that you can try more than one.

Horrible service. Long story short, out of 5 people in my party, It took at least an hour for my food to come out. I had to ask the server 4 times for my food. Each time I asked he told me 5 more minutes. On the fourth ask he told me he’d comp my meal, only to come back 5 minutes later and tell me the kitchen threw out my order. My partner had to ask for the “manager” (I say that loosely because she did not act like a manager), and when she did come over, she asked me what I’d like to do about the fact that there had been a massive miscommunication in her non-busy establishment. When I finally got my food It was decent, but the restaurant is incredibly poorly run. Maybe It was a bad night, but the consensus was that based on our experience we definitely do not recommend nor will come back.
Great service, great food, best doughnut in Chicago. Ill be back.
What a great meal, a new experience yet comforting af.

I was pretty excited to try Chicago's first Okonomiyaki  restaurant but sadly I was highly disappointed. Our party of two couldn't get a table so we just took the bar seat because we didn't want to wait. I could see everything in the open kitchen as the kitchen made the okonomiyaki. As starters we ordered the Beef Korokke and the Twice-Cooked Garlic & Senbei. The Beef Korokke was okay, kind of tasted like a falafe. The Twice Cooked Garlic was such a disappointment .The crackers were SOO HARD even the waiter prefaced use to break it up into pieces before eating and it was still not manageable. Definitely NOT worth the price because the garlic also came with all the Okonomiyaki. We got the flight which we chose chicken, pork, and shrimp. The 'pancake' vegetable mixture was kind of soggy and I could not really tell the difference between each of the toppings to it was the underwhelming. It was very salty and covered in sauce so everything tasted the same. Lastly the popular shaved ice and mochi donuts: we got the Yuzu Kakigori and chocolate mochi donut. The yuzu kakigori was sesame and yuzu flavored but to me that was such a obscured combination that did not set well and the donut did fit the description but it was just the same plain dount covered in different sauces.  Overall I would not come back, the dishes were really expensive and but I think there is room for improvement.
Very good Okonomiyaki, almost as good as in Japan.

What a great experience. Cute atmosphere. Was seated right in front of the cooks, so got to watch our food get made to order. So delicious.  We got the flight so we each got to try 3 of the options each. Each one was amazing in it's own way. Service was amazing. Our server was so pleasant and kind. Cook was adorable and as we were putting our coats on, asked us if everything tasted okay. Such a great place and energy. Definitely would recommend.
Incredible and outstanding experience - hands down one of the most unique and memorable dining experiences I've had in Chicago.
Absolutely amazing! The  octopus was super fresh and the s'mores dessert was amazing!

Gaijin serves comfort food that will do just that. We ordered two starters, the flight, and the scallion pancake and had too much food for two people. Would highly recommend the shrimp and octopus. Order some sake to share and you have a great night!
Amazing!!!!! Maddi our server took great care of us and Paul made sure everything was better than perfect! Unique entrees with a wonderful combination of ingredients. Hiroshima is the BEST!!!
Perfection!
Amazing!  Everything is very tasty, and the service is great.  Wonderful cocktails and dessert as well.  The donuts are incredible!

Amazing atmosphere with live cooking in front of you if you get a good bar seat. Attentive staff, even given a crowded Saturday evening, that take pride in their restaurant. As the first place I've been able to get Hiroshima style okonomiyaki since a trip to Japan, it did not disappoint one bit. Pleasantly surprised by the unique take on the mochi donut but even more taken by the s'mores kakigori (japanese shaved ice of sorts). All in all, a place I can't wait to revisit to make my way through the rest of the menu!
Hiroshima Okinimiyaki was delicious. But the Yakisoba wasn't great
Yummy and quite authentic okonomiyaki, both is osaka- and hiroshima-fu with just enough western flair and premium ingredients all around.

1.5hrs for lunch service!!! The food was really good but taking 30 minutes between soup and the main and then another 25 min after ordering ice cream is insane. The $6 soup was literally 4oz served in a coffee mug half full. The presentation was great. The quality was delicious. The 15 people in the kitchen were super busy but there was only one waitress, one water server, and one busser for the entire place. That’s no way to run a service. So sad.

Dinner, drinks, and service were sublime. The Hiroshima traditional style okonomiyaki was exactly like I remember from our trip to Hiroshima. The flight of Osaka style was also a treat; the octopus was our favorite.
Love the vibe of this restaurant, staff were incredible and food delicious. 100% recommend

Went on the opening day with a couple friends. Service was great and the food is delicious!! Got 3 different okomomiyaki to share between us. We got octopus, tofu, and chicken. The tofu one had really deliciously seasoned mushrooms and normally I don't like mushrooms but they're were amazing. I also liked the octopus one, it wasn't chewy at all which I wasn't expecting. The chicken one was pretty normal so if you're more adventurous then I suggest trying the other two. They also have chairs that serve as storage for your bags and clothes which I loved, especially in this cold weather when I have big winter jacket.  Definitely will go again to try out more of their menu.

Wow!  Second day open and they’re nailing it already!  Excellent & unique food experience from longtime chef Paul Virant. Chicago’s first(?) okonomiyaki spot is simple in its menu but with deep complex flavorings. This is the kind of gem that you will find all over Japan, but in only a handful of cities in the US. Treat yourself and get here soon, before this cozy spot is filled every night.....highly recommended!

Gaijin = Foreigner in Japanese. After having lived in Japan and trying both Hiroshima and Osaka style okonomiyaki I had been hoping the next Asian food trend would be okonomiyaki. When I heard about Gaijin coming to the west loop I was really glad to hear it. Ramen and sushi are great but it's awesome to have something different and just as good and satisfying from that region here. I went the day after they opened and sat at the chef's bar. This gives you the chance to watch them construct what you ordered which is very similar to okonomiyaki shops in Japan. I tried the Hiroshima traditional okonomiyaki and it was great and similar to when I last had it in Hiroshima. I'll surely be back to try to the Osaka style and other offerings on the menu.  The staff was helpful and friendly. When I told the waiter that I previously had okonomiyaki in Japan he quickly gave me the menu and got out of the way which is nice. Some places feel the need to over explain things even if you're familiar with it. The place looks great inside with nice dark wood tables and chairs with red seat cushions that echo a modern contemporary Japanese setting. The chairs double as storage so don't forget your things if you use them! Overall, I'm glad Gaijin came along to shake up the admittedly delicious inundation of ramen shops in the west loop with a different but equally delicious Japanese food.

Okonomiyaki is my favorite food I had in my travels in Japan. I was so excited that a restaurant specializing in it was opening in Chicago. Gaijin is excellent! The yakisoba and Hiroshima style okonomiyaki are the best things on the menu, and live up to what I got in Japan. The Osaka style, while very good, could be improved. I was hoping for more flavor in it. The kakigori is also wonderful, do not skip dessert here.

Today the West Loop added a real gem to it's crown with the opening of Gajin.  Approachable menu, attentive staff and food that left me planning my next trip before the second bite.  The okonamiyaki flight is a great way to sample the different options. I got the pork, octopus and the tofu (featuring tofu from Phoenix Bean Tofu). Despite my love for octopus the tofu was hands down my favorite. I can't stop thinking about the mushrooms in it. Soooo good. Don't pass it up!  Also, get yourself a highball, order some kakigori to share and for the love of all things good in this world do not leave without a mochi donut.
Great shaved ice, mochi doughnuts and Yakisoba!

Had the great fortune to check out Gaijin on opening night with a few friends. We sat at the chefs counter and got to watch the cooking up close.  The menu is broken down simply and the staff are extremely attentive and helpful - explaining any part or item that we didn’t know. Chef Virant even gave me suggestions of where to go on an upcoming trip to Japan.  I went with the Osaka style Okonomiyaki flight - a selection of 3 (Shrimp, Beef, and Octopus).  My friends both went with the traditional Hiroshima style which has layered ingredients including yakisoba.  Can’t wait to come back again and try more items.
When you want something you've never had before, some okonomiyaki hits the spot!
